results.title: Man's experience of the world
results.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
Two interviews with a businessman approaching the end of his successful career and an occupant of a rural commune to study the differences between them and how they relate to the themes in the unit being studied, ie the Social Science Course.

results.title: Identity
results.creator_credit: Michael Philps, Victor Lockwood, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
One of a series of a third level course from the Faculty of Social Science, Open University. The purpose is to provide insight into social behaviour and experience focussing on theories, findings and methods of social psychology. In this episode Norman Leighton, a young artist who grew up in the East End of London, talks about his youth and his art.

results.title: Early interactions (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Philps, Victor Lockwood, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
H.R. Schaffer introduces five experiments which demonstrate the importance of synchronisation between mother and baby. The experiments also show that it is often the baby who initiates the interactions.

results.title: Working to a system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”.
Production problems in the smaller business are of two main types: getting the most from existing resources and gearing production for expansion. Both are examined and advice is given on meeting some of the special difficulties likely when mechanisation is introduced, on management controls, the use of charts for production planning and order processing.

results.title: Survival of the fittest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”
Why small businesses grow or die - an investigation based on interviews with the principals of a number of firms, ranging from a one-man factory that is doing well to a dynamic enterprise. Gives examples of the special problems of those who inherit a family firm. Small firms are especially vulnerable but sometimes compensate with special satisfactions.

results.title: The Hard sell
results.creator_credit: Paul Ellis, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”.
How can the smaller firm make money from better marketing? Interviews with business and marketing experts establish several valuable selling approaches. Stresses the importance of making the right product, and keeping production and sales in step. Includes advice on both home and export sales. NB: Dated and “politically incorrect” in some segments.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”.

Stresses the importance of making the right product, and keeping production and sales in step. Includes advice on both home and export sales. NB: Dated and “politically incorrect” in some segments.

results.title: Finance in the balance
results.creator_credit: Paul Ellis, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”.
The financial problems of the smaller firm, including getting a bank loan, what the bank looks for before giving financial support, and how a businessman can control finances. Also examines some of the most common causes of mortality in small companies.

results.title: Oxy Acetylene Welding
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Skills”.
Explains the process of welding; cutting, braising, bronze-welding and heating, and demonstrates exercises to practice to acquire the skills necessary to become a competent welder. Also demonstrates correct and safe procedures to follow when closing down.
